Trial_Design.evidence: Patients were randomized to laser versus radiofrequency ablation (RFA).

Participants.evidence: Patients diagnosed by percutaneous biopsy (ultrasound or stereotactic-guided) with breast cancer ≤1.5cm, >1cm from the skin and <5mm residual disease by MRI were accrued to this IRB-approved study.

Intervention.evidence: Patients were randomized to laser versus radiofrequency ablation (RFA).

Objective.evidence: Objectives: Percutaneous ablation of breast cancer has shown promise as a treatment alternative to open lumpectomy.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Patients were randomized to laser versus radiofrequency ablation (RFA).

Number_Randomised.evidence: 21 patients were accrued to the study.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Fifteen patients received RFA and all showed 100% ablation and negative margins.
